I20031119

Test case:
I have modified the Ant UI plugin.xml for the objectContribution for IFile by 
adding:
 <visibility>
     <objectState name="xmlFirstTag" value="project"/>
 </visibility> 
I have an empty file called build.xml
Select this file in the PackageExplorer
Right click to realize the context menu

Similar problems occur for a buildfile that has errors in it. For example a 
file that only contains:
<pro
*** Bug 47380 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Created an attachment (id=7102)
Fix (patch)

It appears that both xerces and crimson SAX parsers will throw a
SAXParseException if they encounter an empty file.  Personally, I would just
think there was no work to do and move on.  Now the PropertyParser will look
for a zero-length file and end parsing gracefully before calling SAX.

Debbie I do not see how this will handle the other fatal parsing errors..eg a 
build.xml file that only has "<pro" in it?
This bug appears to be fixed.

Sorry, I was wrong...no change in status for fatal parsing errors other than an 
empty build file.
*** Bug 48633 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Class PropertyParser has been deprecated.  The extension point 
org.eclipse.core.runtime.contentTypes should be used instead.  This internal 
class and associated contants will be removed for the next major release.
